title: Best NBN in NSW?
body:
Hi,

I'm getting NBN and I was just wondering what is the best provider in terms of ping (for league especially), download spd and upload spd with no spikes etc?. Gonna be getting the highest tier pack. Is TPG any good? (Sydney btw)

Thanks.

replies.body: The best type of NBN is not getting NBN.

All the ISP's provide the same connection and use the same line except the government does not want to remove the copper hence the $$$. You will not get a high speed just because you are on the NBN connection. The closer you are to the NBN node, the better the connection will be. You also need to take into consideration of the fact how many people use the Internet in your family and also environmental factors. I am right next to the node so i get 98mpbs with 8 ping. Find out how close you are to the node, compare prices and find out what is the best in your area by making a few calls. Please remember the main factor is how close you are to the NBN node. Not the ISP. Hope this helps!
Ah thanks for your response. My area shows "FTTP (1000 Mbps)" (purple colour). What ping should this get me?
FTTP is 10 times better than what we all have which is FTTN. NBN connection does not dictate your ping... whatever ping you had before I would subtract 15-20 and that is most likely your new ping.
^ Highly accurate. Until the government clean up this mess, I don't think Internet is high on the bucket list. We are almost 70th in line and behind Romania as far as Internet speed is concerned

> [{quoted}](name=Rengorax,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=5tW8q3hR,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2018-02-04T23:48:57.441+0000)
>
> FTTP is 10 times better than what we all have which is FTTN. NBN connection does not dictate your ping... whatever ping you had before I would subtract 15-20 and that is most likely your new ping.

Yeah I'm getting FTTP TPG so hopefully should be good.

I am not sure what ping this would get you, but you will be very happy with NBN connection. If you want to see where the node is, it should be at the end of your street (big silver thing or box), the closer you are to this the better. And also find out which ISP is the best for you e.g TPG or Telstra etc. Either way it is NBN and currently the best thing in AUS at the moment. At the moment i get 98mps download as I am 2 steps away from the node. So I chose the 100mbps plan with TPG. I pay for everything so find out what is the best for your family but I always like to go extreme haha.

I pay for everything so find out what is the best for your family but I always like to go extreme haha.

Yeah haha thanks for that. Just got the 100/40 TPG FTTP :)
No worries man! Let me know how you go :)
So just updating, got the TPG FTTP, gives 9 ping on wifi. **Haven't tried Ethernet yet**. 90 download/35 upload when near the modem on WiFi on speedtest.

lagreport.com

It'll tell you the best providers for your area (for playing League). Gives em all a score based on connection quality, reliability etc

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=5tW8q3hR,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-02-03T07:18:32.961+0000)
>
> lagreport.com
> 
> It'll tell you the best providers for your area (for playing League). Gives em all a score based on connection quality, reliability etc

https://i.gyazo.com/0f928cfab17aaf60ffff306c58b196fc.png

Already a bad site to rate Telstra that high.

Connection quality varies a lot by area. In some places Telstra is the best best provider (their shit plans aside), in others it's not. Lagreport looks at very specific things with regards only to League, not to everything internet.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=5tW8q3hR,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2018-02-05T10:43:08.196+0000)
>
> Connection quality varies a lot by area. In some places Telstra is the best best provider (their shit plans aside), in others it's not. Lagreport looks at very specific things with regards only to League, not to everything internet.

I know, but am I really a Telstra fan if I don't rag on them at every point I can?
Yeah, I just tried this. Thanks for the suggestion, its pretty helpful.

They are all basically the same since the NBN lines themselves are controlled by NBNco.

If you don't have FTP/FTB/FTC your connection is going to be subject to how good your area lines are.

I would just get the best deal with no contract so if there are any problems you can just switch easily. Most ISPs have unlimited data plans for $60-70.
